candidates.title: Bump MSRV to 1.56.0 and update `windows-sys` to 0.52
Update windows-sys requirement from 0.42.0 to 0.45.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Updates the requirements on [windows-sys](https://github.com/microsoft/windows-rs) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from windows-sys's releases.

0.45.0

As a reminder, updates are only published by request (#2299). This release provides an update to the windows-sys crate. It does not include an update to the windows crate.

This is the first update to the windows-sys crate in 4 months and primarily includes a number of fixes stemming from improvements to the Win32 metadata. Optional support for raw-dylib is now also provided.

What's Changed

  • Remove field cfg attribute queries by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2280
  • Only show visible windows and include x/y in output by @​jessemcdowell in microsoft/windows-rs#2284
  • Linux build support by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2290
  • Slices should use default (optional) type by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2293
  • Version 0.45 by @​kennykerr in microsoft/windows-rs#2299

New Contributors

  • @​jessemcdowell made their first contribution in microsoft/windows-rs#2284

Changelog for windows-sys crate: https://github.com/microsoft/windows-rs/compare/0.42.0...0.45.0

Commits
  • ddf5ebb Version 0.45 (#2299)
  • e06dc97 Slices should use default types (#2293)
  • 2266e23 Linux build support (#2290)
  • 17a5f00 Update readme.md
  • 50b241e Sample: show visible windows and include coordinates (#2284)
  • f5373bb Remove field cfg attribute queries (#2280)
  • 87ef216 Update publish script
  • 6f115da Version 0.44.0 (#2279)
  • 7c65c07 Add Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) sample (#2277)
  • 1bfd409 Update readme.md
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

candidates.title: Configure WASM tests an try isatty on wasi
Drop remaining usages of `regex`
candidates.body:
This PR drops all the remaining usages of `regex` for handwritten parsers

I ran [a simple fuzz target](https://gist.github.com/CosmicHorrorDev/448e5bf0f1124d5fa7b1291103f62a11) comparing the old and new implementation for a few hours to preemptively find any regressions

candidates.title: Drop once_cell because of MSRV bump
candidates.body:
This removes `once_cell` again because of the recent MSRV bump. See https://github.com/matklad/once_cell/issues/201

I will revisit this at a later point, for now I just want to postpone the MSRV discussion for a bit.

Refs #134

candidates.title: Validate minver
candidates.body:
This validates that the `Cargo.toml` enforces minver correctly. It also moves back to `Makefile` based testing as I found no way outside of GitHub actions to run the tests.

Refs https://github.com/mitsuhiko/insta/pull/248

candidates.title: Use handwritten ansi parser
candidates.body:
# Motivation

`indicatif` recently removed their direct dependency on `regex`, but it still ends up getting pulled in through the `ansi-parsing` feature of this crate.

# Implementation

There's nothing too exciting here. The regex was switched out for a manually implemented dfa. The dfa is represented by `State` which is driven by `find_ansi_code_exclusive`. I went through a few iterations and the dfa implementation seemed to be the cleanest in the end.

There are also a myriad of tests to try and ensure that things match the old implementation. Notably there is a proptest checking off the old regex and a test that generates strings with bytes used in ansi codes up to 6 characters long in an attempt to ensure that everything matches the old implementation.

Also beyond that I tested things with `dfa_matches_regex_on_small_strings` with up to 11 byte strings using the limited character set and I ran another test that tried all valid 5 byte or small strings to make sure they matched the old regex `Matches`. This wasn't kept in the test suite since things would take far too long to give fast feedback.

# Impact

`regex` is a notably heavy dependency, so being able to remove it had some good improvements all around

## Compile Time

Clean `cargo build --release --features ansi-parsing`, timed with:

```cmd
$ hyperfine --warmup 1 --prepare 'cargo clean' 'cargo build --release --features ansi-parsing'
```

### Before

```text
Benchmark 1: cargo build --release --features ansi-parsing
  Time (mean ± σ):      5.395 s ±  0.061 s    [User: 28.892 s, System: 0.697 s]
  Range (min … max):    5.304 s …  5.531 s    10 runs
```

### After

```text
Benchmark 1: cargo build --release --features ansi-parsing
  Time (mean ± σ):      2.401 s ±  0.021 s    [User: 5.150 s, System: 0.405 s]
  Range (min … max):    2.374 s …  2.441 s    10 runs
```

## Size

I wasn't sure if there was an ideal way to measure this. I setup a crate that depended on just `console` and printed out the results of `AnsiCodeIterator` on the string `"hi"`. I also `strip`ped the executable for good measure since there was a large size reduction from stripping such a simple executable

Size results from `cargo build --release && strip target/release/testing`

*Before:* 653 KiB
*After:*  305 KiB

## Speed

I didn't directly test speed so this one is still unknown. I guess a good approach would be adding a benchmark to check the throughput for the new implementation iterating over something like `sample_zellij_session.log` and then backporting the benchmark to master to compare. From the small strings used in `dfa_matches_regex_on_small_string`, the new implementation was about 4x faster.

candidates.title: Make windows console colors optional
candidates.body:
The changes to make emulate the ansi codes for older windows versions are buggy. It's also unclear if this feature has any realistic benefit since people are more likely to run console apps on windows 10.

This removes the feature from the default feature list to give people a better user experience.

See #69.

candidates.title: Remove termios dependency
candidates.body:
Since the libc crate provides the same functions as the termios crate,
prefer to use it, as platform support is better (Redox, etc.)

candidates.title: Depend on `winapi-util` 0.1.3
candidates.body:
The package depends on things added in that version - https://github.com/BurntSushi/winapi-util/commit/d33486e0c0c7ef73450ac02a563d914906768827

Fixes issues such as https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo-bisect-rustc/issues/89

candidates.title: Make regex optional by moving ansi stripping behind feature flag
candidates.body: Make regex dependency optional. This should help cutting down dependencies of insta (https://github.com/mitsuhiko/insta/issues/102).

candidates.title: Add repository url to Cargo.toml
candidates.body: This makes this repository easier to find when clicking through docs.rs/console.

candidates.title: Trim down dependencies
candidates.body: This removes a bunch of dependencies from the crate or moves them to an optional mode (unicode for unicode_width).
